This weapon will return to your hand when thrown. You cannot be forced to drop the trident. When thrown, the weapon creates an explosion that deals [1] in a [2] blast centred on the target.
You may toggle this feature on and off. If toggled off the weapon will deal [1] to the target instead of exploding.

Targets hit with this weapon must succeed a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag> for 2 turns.

Automatically cast Divine Smite when you land a Critical Hit with a melee or thrown weapon attack.

The highest available spell slot will be used to maximise damage.
When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee or thrown weapon attack, you deal an extra dice of weapon damage.
You have a +1 bonus to damage with melee and thrown weapons for every turn this condition has remaining.
After a successful attack with a weapon, you can cast illusion or enchantment spells as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.

You've trained to strike swift and true. When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with your melee or thrown main hand attack, you roll an extra damage die as well as the normal additional critical dice.
